### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > when adguard is enabled posts won't load, disabled works normally. ### Screenshots

Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/OQJoqNH.png)

AdGuard Base

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances

Language-specific:
AdGuard Turkish Other extensions used: | Nothing else, facebook homepage won't load if adguard is enabled for the last 2 days. It loads as soon as adguard is disabled. Filters are up-to-date.

pull_request.title: merge duplicate rules 3
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: www.nytimes.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/13/business/bed-bath-beyond-bankruptcy-assets.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2023%2F01%2F13%2Fbusiness%2Fbed-bath-beyond-bankruptcy-assets.html) ### Comment Username: @Adguard-fixme > Continue Reading in the App popup at bottom of screen. This occurs on various pages on the site. It also greys out and disables the background. If I turn on the AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter it hides the element but the screen still greys out and disables input. I am logged in to the site so that may contribute to the problem—though I don’t know that for sure. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/Gkc0yLx.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard/AdGuard Pro for iOS v4.4.5 Browser: | Safari DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

comment.body:
Adam, I spent some time messing around with the safari debugger on my Mac connected to my iPad. Again, I know very little about web stuff but I’m retired from a life in IT so I get around and clearly must be a little bored. Anyway, when I go to a story like this one: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/19/us/desantis-florida-ap-african-american-studies.html I think it runs a script that is contained in another file https://www.nytimes.com/vi-assets/static-assets/story-7b870824025a8e3b4049.js That script appears to have code in it that adds a class dynamically to the original HTML page using createelement statement. That class does this pop-up thing I believe. I browsed the page directly on the Mac (no iPad) and while it does run the same script which contains the same code, it does not add it to the page on the Mac. I’m guessing there is logic in the script somewhere that determines the platform. The class that gets added to the page is below (though I manually formated it). I am wondering if blocking it with a Safari user rule on the iPad would work. But I’m not sure exactly how content filters are formatted. Would you be willing to help me with the safari user rule syntax? I’m guessing it’s something like nytimes.com ###div.read-in-app…. But I tried a few variations and had no luck. Would the user rule prevent the script from adding the div class programmatically? Anyway I appreciate all your help. Here is the class that gets created:

Continue reading in the app — it’s better

Stay logged in and get customized notifications.

Exploring articles will be easier, too.

> On Jan 19, 2023, at 1:31 AM, Adam ***@***.***> wrote: > > > @AdamWr could you please take a look? > > Unfortunately, I have no idea how to reproduce this, I don't even see it even when I'm logged in. > Could you please try to block this grey element by using the Block elements on this page option? > To use this option, please tap on the AdGuard icon on Safari's address bar and then try to select this grey element, maybe created rule will be helpful. > If this rule will works, then please provide it here. > > — > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub , or unsubscribe . > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. >
